input: Imagine a self-contained, hypothetical world with only the following conditions, and without any unmentioned factors or causal relationships: Having a brother has a direct effect on skill. Skill has a direct effect on salary. The overall probability of having a brother is 81%. The probability of not having a brother and high salary is 8%. The probability of having a brother and high salary is 59%. Is the chance of high salary smaller when observing having a brother?
